column3: CAISO Price  mitigation compliance: generation service customer assistance
column6: CAISO and FERC require cost justification for "above-cap" sales
column8: Assist clients in making filings on their own behalf. Next Step - monitor market activity and assist in cost support as necessary.  Create workable must-offer mechanism

column6: SCE and PG&E owe Enron for Negative CTC accrued since March 2000.
column8: 1.  PG&E recovery tied into PG&E Bankruptcy.  2.  PG&E and SCE have not returned net bill amount to EES' customers with our return to DA.  3.  EES filed CPUC complaint to recoup our net bills.  4.  PG&E in discussions inside bankruptcy.  5. SCE settles outstanding Federal Court case with CPUC allowing SCE to recover $3.3 Billion (language appears to provide for recovery).  Key Risk - FERC refund case may impact our claim by reducing wholesale market prices - attempting to determine impact.

column5: small immediate impact, but CAISO rules keep Enron from participation
column6: CAISO has implemented various aspects of the FERC rule incorrectly: it is not requiring a creditworthy buyer (ie:  CDWR to buy the full net short position), it is requiring thermal units to make a power available at a loss
column8: Rehear FERC decisions and protest CAISO compliance filings.  Provide information to media.   Next Step is to monitor and respond as appropriate.  Feed information to FERC on ISO's violations of its own tariffs.

column5: small immediate impact, but CAISO rules keep Enron from participation
column6: CAISO is in violation of several FERC orders and its own tariffs
column8: Coordination with other generators and marketers.                                                                                     Provide assistance to FERC and its auditors.  Get media attention on process

column6: CPUC has published Proposed Decision that would retroactively end DA as of July 1, 2001.
column8: 1.  Work with other members of AReM coalition to convince CPUC that this action would be disastrous and result in unnecessary legal fights.
Review ISO Data for acuracy and develop recievable counter claims.

column3: Rate agreement between DWR and CPUC
column6: California PUC voted down Davis' propsed rate agreement between DWR and the CPUC.                                                                                -Davis' proposal would remove all PUC authority to review any contracts between DWR with suppliers, and would require the PUC to pass through utility rates all DWR power contract costs, no questions asked.
column8: A broad left-right coalition of energy intersets supported a bill that passed the Legislature with broad bipartisan support.  Davis doesn't want to sign the bill, but may have no alternative.

column6: PUC approved an Edison bailout 10-2-2001.                                                  1. Commission will keep current rates in place through 2003                      2. Any "overcollection" will go toward paying off $3.3 billion.                  3. If Edison collects the $3.3 billion prior to 2003, then rates can change.
Oregon's version of direct access begins Q2, 2002
column8: Understand evolving rules and pursue profitable strategies.  Next Step -Collaborate with commercial counterparts to develop deal opportunities

column6: Given current forward curve; QF contract buyouts look promising.  Utility interest may be heightened given current rate and credit pressures
column8: Assist commercial team on a screening curve analysis.  Develop project types that are most promising from a buyout perspective; consider similar approach in Nevada; keep an eye on impacts on "in-CA" and renewable production to prevent political backlash.   Next step is a presentation to Edison to gain utility support.

column6: We are assisting ENA origination in the development of a CT in Longview Washington.
column8: Assisting on an as-available basis.  Key Issue is to gain permits.  Developable projects are near completion.

column6: PUC assigned cost of 1c/kwh Surcharge to DA and non-DA.
column8: Enron working through AREM to modify CPUC rule that 1c/kwh Surcharge applies to DA.

column6: We are working with ENA origination on a number of potential transactions with the state of Montana public power authority.
column8: Continue discussions.  Business teams will present proposal soon.
